page.title: 07Botany of Tickhill Castle
page.content: Tickhill Castle is going through some archaeological and historical research and to everyone's surprise there are a lot of plants that were from the medieval period.A lady did quite a lot of research telling us how useful each plant could be,for example{Aarons Rod} has leaves which are made up of tiny branched hair.This was made into wicks for candles.Roots of{Arum}have starch inside.This was used for starching ruffs which were fashionable in those days.From the continent comes{Feverfew and it is said to cure headaches.There were at least 8 more plant types.These were used for their herbal qualities before 20th.century medicines.The area at the top of the motte,where the stone tower was,is divided off into 2m square sections.All the findings will go onto graph paper as a recording of how the plants spread.
